newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia rubber ends lower, tracks Tokyo's fall.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia rubber ends lower, tracks Tokyo's fall.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices extended losses at the close following a weak trend in Tokyo and continued absence of consumer demand, dealers said.
"There's nothing new in the market. Buyers are not coming in while sellers are also in no hurry to sell," said one trader. "The paper market may come off further if Tokyo stays weak."
He said some dealers were away celebrating the last day of the Chinese Lunar New Year festival.
Traders said physical prices have been flat as producers were holding back in anticipation of tighter supply during the wintering period.
At the close, benchmark March RSS1 buyer was quoted by the Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board at 303 cents ($1.22) a kg, down a cent from Thursday.
March SMR 20 buyer was down two cents at 296 cents ($1.19).
Trading houses offered the SMR 20 at 297 cents a kg, SMR CV at 359, SMR L at 339, SMR 5 at 307, SMR 10 at 298 and drum latex FOB at 237.
The INRO five-day moving average was 234.42 Malaysian/Singapore cents per kg on Feb 20 against 234.72 on Feb 19. The daily indicator price was 234.10 versus 234.35.
